Key Match Events: Pakistan kept alive their slim hopes of reaching the T20 World Cup semi-finals with a 33-run victory over South Africa.
Iftikhar Ahmed and Shadab Khan scored spectacular half-centuries to help Pakistan post 185 for nine.
Shaheen Afridi claimed two early wickets with figures of 3-14.
Shadab Khan removed Temba Bavuma and Aiden Markram in quick succession.
South Africa resumed with a revised target of 142 from five more overs under the Duckworth–Lewis–Stern method but fell short at 108 for nine.
Mohammad Haris scored a blistering 28 off 11 balls.
Iftikhar Ahmed hit 51 and Shadab Khan clubbed 52 off 22 balls in a partnership of 82 for the sixth wicket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain-shortened the match and revised South Africa's target under the Duckworth–Lewis–Stern method.
South Africa remains in second place behind India in Group 2 despite the loss.
